VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U16 (const uint16_t *restrict binEdges, const int32_t numBins, uint16_t *restrict histArray)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U16 ( const uint16_t *restrict  binEdges,
const int32_t  numBins,
uint16_t *restrict  histArray 
)

Description
Initializes buffer for 1D histogram computation by VLIB_histogram_1D_U16, or VLIB_weightedHistogram_1D_U16.
Parameters:
[in] *binEdges Array containing the edges of the histogram bins (UQ16.0)
[in] numBins Number of bins (SQ31.0)
[in,out] *histArray Buffer for internal use (UQ16.0)
Assumptions
  • The values of binEdges must increase monotonically.
  • histArray should be initialized to 0.
  • histArray should have a size equal to the max possible value that the input quantity can take + 1 (eg. if max value of input is 1023, then histArray should be of size 1024 bytes). This is done to save memory for cases where arrays values do not span the full range that the data type allows for.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
